content.webTitle: Irish online player sets its sights on Aim listing

fields.headline: Irish online player sets its sights on Aim listing
fields.bodyText: Gameaccount, which is owned by some of Ireland's richest industrialists, is to become the latest online gambling group to seek a stock market listing. Its owners are to appoint advisers this week to work on bringing the business to the Alternative Investment Market by Christmas with an expected valuation of £100m. Founded in 2001 by Dermot Smurfit, Gameaccount hosts the world's largest online tournaments for backgammon, gin rummy and blackjack, and stages golf, darts and pool games. It has yet to break even and its annual revenues are €2m (£1.4m).
